alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:10AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, northwestern King William and central Essex Counties through 945 AM EDT... At 908 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mangohick, or 9 miles east of Ashland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beulahville and Manquin around 925 AM EDT. Aylett around 930 AM EDT. Saint Stephens Church around 940 AM EDT. Millers Tavern and Stevensville around 945 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Enfield, Central Garage, Owenton, Upshaw, Etna Mills, Walkerton, Epworth, Biscoe, Calno and Rumford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen
